thread.title: Nancy Pelosi: Congress Has to Read Obamacare Replacement Bill Before It Votes
thread.title_full: Nancy Pelosi: Congress Has to Read Obamacare Replacement Bill Before It Votes

author: John Falkenberg
title: Nancy Pelosi: Congress Has to Read Obamacare Replacement Bill Before It Votes
text:
Dem Rep. Gwen Moore Proposes Plan To Stop American Funding for Trump’s Wall 
This is rich, coming from the same person who said of Obamacare that “we have to pass the bill so that you can find out what’s in it”— which still stands as one of the most infamous statements of the Obama years. 
Regardless, here she writes that the government is (suddenly) accountable to the American people. 
“Members must not be asked to vote on this legislation before the Congressional Budget Office and the Joint Committee on Taxation have answered the following questions about your legislation in 2018 and 2019, over the 10-year budget window, and in the decade after,” she wrote. Advertisement - story continues below 
“How will this bill measure up to the Affordable Care Act and current Medicaid law on coverage, quality, and cost? And how will it impact Medicare solvency?” 
Now, government accountability is a great thing, but that isn’t the point here. 
The point is that Democrats in power have two sets of standards — one for when they’re trying to ram things down the throats of the American people, and another for somebody else’s projects. 
They don’t care if that’s a contradiction, because they are so convinced of their being on the right side of history that their ludicrous ends justify their idiotic means. Advertisement - story continues below
